intro: Spyridium serpyllaceum, commonly known as the common spyridium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and heathlands. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Spyridium serpyllaceum is well adapted to arid conditions and is often found in regions with low rainfall.
